# Bio
******  

Rob Smith is a data scientist and analyst with Washington State University's [Office of Institutional Research](https://ir.wsu.edu/){target="_blank"}.  Rob's work lies at the broad intersection of higher education and high-dimensional statistics.  Trained as a quantitative ecologist, he previously was a research fellow with US Forest Service's [Air Resource Management Program](https://www.fs.fed.us/air/index.htm){target="_blank"} in Washington, DC, and a researcher with the [USFS Forest Inventory and Analysis](https://www.fs.usda.gov/pnw/program/rma){target="_blank"} program in the Pacific Northwest.  He has taught courses in the [Dept of Botany and Plant Pathology](https://bpp.oregonstate.edu){target="_blank"} at Oregon State University after earning his PhD there with a focus on detection and prediction of climate signals using bioindicators.  For a decade he worked in construction, mills, landscaping, and mountaineering.
